description: This file defines an API client for a Flutter application, including a singleton class that manages HTTP requests to a backend server. It provides methods for GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE operations, handles authorization tokens via shared preferences, and reads configuration from environment variables or defaults.

classes.name: ApiException
classes.description: Custom exception class that encapsulates HTTP error responses, including status code and message.

classes.name: ApiClient
classes.description: Singleton class providing methods for making HTTP requests to the backend API, managing headers, base URL configuration, and response processing.

methods.name: ApiClient()
methods.description: Factory constructor that returns the singleton instance of ApiClient.

methods.name: baseUrl getter
methods.description: Determines the base URL for API requests from environment variables, dart-define, or a default fallback.

methods.name: _headers
methods.description: Asynchronously constructs the request headers, including authorization tokens fetched from shared preferences.

methods.name: _uri
methods.description: Constructs a Uri object from a path and optional query parameters, normalizing the URL.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Performs an HTTP GET request to the specified path with optional query parameters.

methods.name: post
methods.description: Performs an HTTP POST request with an optional JSON body.

methods.name: put
methods.description: Performs an HTTP PUT request with an optional JSON body.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Performs an HTTP DELETE request to the specified path.

methods.name: _processResponse
methods.description: Processes the HTTP response, decoding JSON if successful, or throwing an ApiException if an error occurs.
